item.description:
In the East, the mind is often referred to as the thousand-headed cobra. Why? Ask anyone what their biggest challenge is in trying to meditate and they’ll tell you: “The mind.” We have 50,000 thoughts a day – or, rather, they have us. We get rid of one, and fifty more pop up. Where would we be if we could control our mind? Everyone agrees we are body plus mind plus spirit. Everyone agrees that the spirit part is the real “me.” But how do we get to it? In meditation, when the chatter of the mind ceases, in the stillness of perfect silence, we find peace, joy, and discover who we really are. for more information
